meanings.definition: ancientest: superlative form of ancient, meaning the oldest or most ancient
meanings.sent1: The ancientest tree in the forest stood tall and wise.
meanings.sent2: The ancientest ruins in the city date back thousands of years.
meanings.sent3: The ancientest rock in the garden likes to tell stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom was as ancientest as the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The ancientest book in the library held secrets of forgotten civilizations.

meanings.definition: ancientest: belonging to or existing in a remote period of time in the past
meanings.sent1: The ancientest artifacts unearthed by archaeologists amazed everyone.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of the ancientest kingdom lost to time.
meanings.sent3: The ancientest coin in his collection was worth more than gold.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held an ancientest sadness, as if carrying the weight of centuries.
meanings.sent5: The ancientest song echoed through the valley, stirring memories of bygone days.
